R94291-14 SHOVED THEIR TRAIN,  WITHOUT PROTECTING THE SHOVE MOVE, OUT THE END OF TRACK GL19.  R94291-14 SHOVEDBCOL 41717 INTO GTW 187597 AND UNIT BNSF 5424 THAT WERE STANDING UNOCCUPPIED ON TRACK 18.  THE CREWTHAT WAS ORIGINALLY ON THE UNOCCUPPIED UNITS AND CARS WERE INSTRUCTED TO LEAVE THESE OUT TO FOUL ONTRACK 18.  THE IMPACT CAUSED THE DERAILED CARS TO BE PUSHED INTO GATX 60708 ON TRAIN L54391-14 WHICHWAS STANDING ON TRACK GL23.  A TOTAL OF 9 CARS AND 1 ENGINE WERE DERAILED IN THE IMPACT.  BCOL 41717 ENDED UP ON IT'S SIDE.  R94291-14'S TRAIN CREW WAS DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

1-d-02-05-07-CGBX.Narrative: ENGINEER WAS SORTING RAILCARS ON THE EAST END OF THE LADDER TRACKS USING A REMOTE CONTROLLED LOCOMOTIVE AND TRANSMITTER.  HE HAD COUPLER TO 5 LOADED RAILCARS ON THE EAST END OF TRACK 1, WHICH HE INTENDED TO PULL AND SHOVE ONTO THE EAST END OF TRACK 2.  EMPLOYEE STATES HE COUPLED TO THE CARS AND STRETCHED THE SLACK TO ASSURE A GOOD COUPLE.  HE THEN MADE AIR TO THE RAILCARS.  HE PULLED THE CARS IN AN EAST DIRECTION PAST THE 1 AND 2 SWITCH, STOPPED AND LINED THE SWITCH FOR TRACK 2 AND CLIMBED ONTOTHE LEAD CAR TO PROTECT THE HEAD OF MOVEMENT AND PROCEEDED TO SHOVE IN A WEST DIRECTION.  AFTER 2 CARS OF THE CARS WERE IN THE CLEAR ON THE TRACK 2 HE SLOWED PREPARING TO DISMOUNT.  AT THIS TIME THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  THE ENGINEER STATES HE THOUGHT THE EMERGENCY APPLICATION WAS DUE TO ONE OF THE SAFETY FEATURES ON THE REMOTE SYSTEM  (TILT SWITCH, E-STOP BUTTON, DEADMAN FEATURE, LOW BATTERY) WHICH WILL OCCASIONALLY ACTUATE DUE TO VARIOUS REASON OR POSSIBLY DUE TO VERY LOW TEMPERATURES AND MOISTURE IN THE AIR SYSTEM.  IT WAS UN KNOWN TO THE ENGINEER AT THIS TIME THAT THE KNUCKLE ON THERAILCAR NEXT TO THE LOCOMOTIVE HAD OPENED UP AND SEPARATED FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE.  AFTER THE CARS WENTINTO EMERGENCY THEY ROLLED APPROXIMATELY 1 CAR LENGTH STOPPING ON THE TRACK 2 SWITCH.  THE LOCOMOTIVE STOPPED ALMOST IMMEDIATELY WHICH LEFT APPROX. 1 CAR LENGTH BETWEEN THE ENGINE AND THE 5 LOADED RAILCARS. AT THIS TIME THE ENGINEER DISMOUNTED THE CARS AND PROCEEDED TO CHEEK

546645-d-02-16-07-GTW.Narrative: YARD JOB RCS4061-16 WAS DOUBLING UP 32 CARS FORM DAVID ROAD YARD UP THROUGH SOUTH YARD #3 WHEN THE 5TH CAR BEHIND THE UNIT, TTGX 851224, DERAILED AT THE #2 SWITCH (SF02 TRACK) ON THE EAST END. WHEN TTGX 941797 DERAILED IT STRUCK BCOL 41786 STANDING WITH A CUT OF 27 CARS ON SF02 DAMAGING AND DERAILING BCOL 41786.  INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THESWITCH HAD BEEN RUN THRU PREVIOUSLY BY AN UNKNOWN CREW. I0307-d-02-18-07-PATH.Narrative: AN ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN WAS MOVING A TWO-CAR CONSIST ONTO 8 TRACK OUTSIDE THE HARRISON CARSHOP FOR STORAGE PURPOSES. HE REPORTED THAT WHEN HE APPLIED THE BRAKES IN FULL SERVICE THE TRAIN CARS FAILED TOSTOP AND SLID WITH BOTH CARS THROUGH THE DOOR CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE DOOR AND OVERHEAD HEATING SYSTEMIN THE BUILDING.  UPON INSPECTION OF CARS 892, 887 AND THE RAILS,  NO DEFECTS WERE FOUND WITH THE BRAKES AND RAILS.  AFTER THE INCIDENT, FLAT SPOTS, BURN MARKS AND TORN METAL WERE FOUND, INDICATING THAT THE BRAKES WERE WORKING AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT AND APPLIED TO THE POINT THAT THE WHEELS NOLONGER TURNED.  ALSO, THE BRAKE SHOES WERE FULLY SEATED ON ALL WHEELS WHEN THE BRAKES WERE APPLIED.THE TRAIN SKID APPROXIMATELY 330 FEET FROM THE FIRST POINT WHEELS BEGAN TO MAKE MARKS AND ON THE RUNNING RAIL TO WHERE THE TRAIN RESTED.  NO INJURIES INVOLVED AS A RESULT OF THE INCIDENT AND THE ENGINEER/SWITCHMAN WAS TESTED AND FOUND NEGATIVE FOR DRUGS AND ALCOHOL.    DAMAGES ARE ESTIMATED AT $50,000.

X08022607-d-02-26-07-FEC.Narrative: A TRACTOR TRUCK, 1998 FORD HAULER, WAS APPROACHING THE CROSSING IN A WESTERLY DIRECTION PULLING A MANUFACTURED MODULAR HOME.  WHEN THE HAULER TRAVERSED THE CROSSING, THE DRIVER FAILED TO RAISE THE HOME AND THE I-BEAM FRAME OF THE HOME DRAGGED ACROSS THE ROADWAY AND TRACKS CAUSING THE LOAD TO DISENGAGE FROM THE HAULER.  UPON REALIZING THE UNITS SEPARATED, THE DRIVER ATTEMPTED TO HOOK THE HAULER BACK UP TO THE HOME.  HE REALIZED A TRAIN WAS APPROACHING AND ABANDONED HIS ATTEMPT TO FREE THE LOAD AND PULLED HIS TRACTOR CLEAR OF HARMS WAY.  AS TRAIN CAME AROUND THE CURVE, THE CREW SAW THE OBSTRUCTION AND PUT THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY BRAKING MODE BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO IMPACT.  NO INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

KS0207106-d-02-12-07-BNSF.Narrative: THE EVIDENCE WE HAVE INDICATED THAT THE DTTX CAR WAS A SLOW ROLLER.  WHILE THERE WERE NOT ANY MECHANICAL DEFECTS NOTED ON THE CAR, THE CAR CAME OUT OF RETARDER AT THREE TIMES THE NORMAL ROLLING RESISTENCE.  THREE RE-ENACTMENTS WERE CONDUCTED AFTER THE DERAILMENT WITH SIMILAR CAR TYPES TO DETERMINE IF THIS PROBLEM WAS ISOLATED TO THE PARTICULAR CAR OR TO CAR TYPE.  THE RE-ENACTMENTS CONCLUDED THATTHE PROBLEM EXISTED WITH THIS PARTICULAR CAR.  THUS, THE CONCLUSION OF THE RE-ENACTMENTS, SUPPORTS OUR DECISION FOR THE MECHANICAL FAILURE AS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT.

2007000010-d-02-22-07-PTRA.Contributing Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
2007000010-d-02-22-07-PTRA.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 13: 45 FEBRUARY 22, 2007 PORT JOB 167 WAS TRAVELING NORTH ON THE EQUITY MAIN/N.LEGOF EQUITY WYE AT APPROXIMATELY 6 MPH.  THEY WERE PULLING THE OUTBOUND UPQPTLU22.  THE 35TH CAR (UTLX903121) PICKED THE SWITCH THAT WOULD BE USED TO ACCESS THE NORTH OR SOUTH LEG OF THE EQUITY WYE FROM EQUITY MAIN.  AT THIS TIME THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF A HIGH FLANGE, IT IS BELIEVED TO BE A SWITCH POINT FAILURE.  THIS CAR HIT THE GROUND, THE L-4 AND L-3 WHEELS TRAVELED ON THE TIE PLATES BETWEEN THERAIL ON THE SOUTH LEG OF THE EQUITY WYE THE R-4 AND R-3 WHEELS MOVED OVER THE TIES BETWEEN THE RAILON THE NORTH LEG OF THE WYE.  AS THE TRAIN MOVED NORTH THE COUPLER HOUSING, A-END ON UTLX 901424 (33RD CAR) BROKE RESULTING IN UTLX 903119 (LINE34) ROLLING ONTO IT'S SIDE BETWEEN THE TWO LEGS OF THEWYE.  AT THIS POINT THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR THE SOUTH LEG OF THE WYE.  THE 36TH CAR OF  (UTLX 901148) WAS DERAILED DUE TO THE SHAPE OF THE TRACK, A RESULT OF UTLX 903121 PULLING  THE RAIL TOGETHER AND THEN OVER THE SOUTH LEG OF THE WYE.
